text: A hare once said to a fox, "Could you tell me if it's true that you're making a lot of money, and why do they call you the winner?" "If you want to know", replied the fox, "I invite you to dinner with me. He took the hare and followed it; but when he came to the house of the fox-wife he saw that there was no dinner but the hare itself. And the hare said, I know now, and am disgraced, where thy name is: it is not by thy works, but by thy deceit. Never ask cheaters for lessons, because you'll be the subject of the lesson.
title: La zorra y la liebre
author: nan Esopo
